metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14608 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
In LibRaw through 0.18.4, an out of bounds read flaw related tokodak_65000_load_raw has been reported in dcraw/dcraw.c andinternal/dcraw_common.cpp. An attacker could possibly exploit this flaw todisclose potentially sensitive memory or cause an application crash.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14608` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libraw-bin - 0.17.1-1ubuntu0.1
libraw15 - 0.17.1-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libraw package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.17.1-1ubuntu0.1').
ufraw: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
darktable: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
exactimage: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
dcraw: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
rawtherapee: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
kodi: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
